qas.question: At which age did Popper first attend university?
What political doctrine interested Popper in 1919?

answers.text: Social Democratic Workers' Party of Austria

qas.question: What incident killed several of Poppers Marxist political comrades?

plausible_answers.text: Social Democratic Workers' Party of Austria

qas.question: What party rejected Marxist ideology at the time?
How many police were shot in the street battle of Horlgasse?

context: Popper left school at the age of <a0_0><b5_0>16<b5_0/><a0_0/> and attended lectures in mathematics, physics, philosophy, <b7_0>psychology<b7_0/> and the history of music as a guest student at the University of Vienna. In 1919, Popper became attracted by <a1_0>Marxism<a1_0/> and subsequently joined the Association of Socialist School Students. He also became a member of the <a2_0><b8_0>Social Democratic Workers' Party of Austria<b8_0/><a2_0/>, which was at that time a party that fully adopted the Marxist ideology. After the <a3_0>street battle in the Hörlgasse<a3_0/> on <b6_0>15 June 1919<b6_0/>, when police shot <b9_0>eight<b9_0/> of his unarmed party comrades, he became disillusioned by what he saw to be the "pseudo-scientific" historical materialism of Marx, abandoned the ideology, and remained a supporter of <a4_0>social liberalism<a4_0/> throughout his life.
